sprain.name: AC Joint Sprain
sprain.description: A sprain of the acromioclavicular joint caused by overstretching or tearing of the ligaments.

sprain.name: Glenohumeral Joint Sprain
sprain.description: An overstretch or tear of the ligaments supporting the glenohumeral (shoulder) joint, often caused by a sudden force or overuse.

tear.name: Rotator Cuff Tear
tear.description: A partial or complete tear of the rotator cuff tendons, often caused by repetitive overhead activities or trauma.

tear.name: Labral Tear
tear.description: An injury to the labrum, the cartilage that surrounds the shoulder socket, leading to pain and instability.

tear.name: SLAP Tear
tear.description: A superior labral tear from anterior to posterior, often resulting from repetitive overhead motions or trauma.

tendinitis.name: Biceps Tendinitis
tendinitis.description: Inflammation of the biceps tendon, typically caused by repetitive overhead motion or overuse.

tendinitis.name: Rotator Cuff Tendinitis
tendinitis.description: Inflammation of the rotator cuff tendons, often caused by overuse or poor posture.

tendinitis.name: Supraspinatus Tendinitis
tendinitis.description: Inflammation of the supraspinatus tendon, one of the rotator cuff muscles, often associated with impingement syndrome.

tendinitis.name: Calcific Tendinitis
tendinitis.description: A condition characterized by calcium deposits in the tendons of the rotator cuff, causing pain and reduced range of motion.

fracture.name: Clavicle Fracture
fracture.description: A break in the collarbone, often caused by a fall on the shoulder or outstretched arm.

fracture.name: Scapular Fracture
fracture.description: A rare fracture of the shoulder blade, typically resulting from high-energy trauma.

fracture.name: Proximal Humerus Fracture
fracture.description: A fracture of the upper arm bone near the shoulder, common in older adults after a fall.

dislocation.name: Anterior Shoulder Dislocation
dislocation.description: The head of the humerus is displaced forward out of the shoulder socket, commonly caused by trauma or extreme rotation.

dislocation.name: Posterior Shoulder Dislocation
dislocation.description: The head of the humerus is displaced backward out of the shoulder socket, often due to seizures or electrical shock.

dislocation.name: Inferior Shoulder Dislocation
dislocation.description: A rare dislocation where the head of the humerus is displaced downward, sometimes caused by hyperabduction.

impingement.name: Subacromial Impingement Syndrome
impingement.description: Compression of the rotator cuff tendons and bursa beneath the acromion, leading to pain and inflammation.

impingement.name: Internal Impingement
impingement.description: Occurs when the rotator cuff tendons are pinched between the humeral head and the glenoid during overhead activities.

bursitis.name: Subacromial Bursitis
bursitis.description: Inflammation of the subacromial bursa, typically associated with repetitive overhead motion or impingement.

bursitis.name: Subdeltoid Bursitis
bursitis.description: Inflammation of the bursa located beneath the deltoid muscle, often caused by overuse or trauma.

sprain.name: Cervical Sprain
sprain.description: Overstretching or tearing of the ligaments in the neck, often caused by sudden movements or trauma such as whiplash.

strain.name: Cervical Muscle Strain
strain.description: An injury to the muscles or tendons in the neck, commonly due to overuse, poor posture, or sudden force.

discopathy.name: Cervical Disc Herniation
discopathy.description: A condition where the inner material of a cervical disc protrudes out, compressing nearby nerves and causing pain or numbness.

discopathy.name: Degenerative Disc Disease
discopathy.description: A wear-and-tear condition where the cervical discs lose their cushioning ability, leading to pain and stiffness.

neuropathy.name: Cervical Radiculopathy
neuropathy.description: Compression or irritation of a nerve root in the cervical spine, often leading to pain, numbness, or weakness in the arms.

neuropathy.name: Thoracic Outlet Syndrome
neuropathy.description: Compression of nerves or blood vessels between the collarbone and first rib, causing pain or tingling in the neck and arms.

fracture.name: Cervical Spine Fracture
fracture.description: A break in one of the cervical vertebrae, often caused by trauma such as falls or car accidents.

dislocation.name: Atlantoaxial Dislocation
dislocation.description: Displacement of the first cervical vertebra (atlas) relative to the second vertebra (axis), typically caused by trauma or congenital conditions.

tendinitis.name: Cervical Tendinitis
tendinitis.description: Inflammation of the tendons in the neck, often due to repetitive movements or strain.

bursitis.name: Cervical Bursitis
bursitis.description: Inflammation of the bursa in the cervical region, leading to pain and reduced neck mobility.

impingement.name: Cervical Spinal Stenosis
impingement.description: Narrowing of the spinal canal in the cervical spine, causing compression of the spinal cord or nerve roots.

sprain.name: Lumbar Sprain
sprain.description: Overstretching or tearing of ligaments in the lower back, often caused by sudden movements or improper lifting.

sprain.name: Thoracic Sprain
sprain.description: Injury to the ligaments in the mid-back region, typically due to trauma or awkward movements.

strain.name: Back Muscle Strain
strain.description: Overuse or overstretching of muscles in the back, often resulting from heavy lifting or poor posture.

strain.name: Erector Spinae Strain
strain.description: Strain in the muscles that run along the spine, commonly caused by overuse or improper movement.

discopathy.name: Herniated Disc
discopathy.description: A condition where the inner material of a spinal disc protrudes, compressing nearby nerves and causing pain or numbness.

discopathy.name: Degenerative Disc Disease
discopathy.description: Progressive degeneration of the spinal discs, leading to chronic pain and reduced flexibility.

discopathy.name: Bulging Disc
discopathy.description: A condition where a spinal disc bulges outward without rupturing, potentially irritating nearby nerves.

neuropathy.name: Sciatica
neuropathy.description: Pain radiating along the sciatic nerve, typically caused by compression in the lower spine.

neuropathy.name: Lumbar Radiculopathy
neuropathy.description: Nerve root irritation in the lower back, leading to pain, numbness, or weakness in the legs.

fracture.name: Compression Fracture
fracture.description: A fracture in the vertebrae due to compression forces, often associated with osteoporosis or trauma.

fracture.name: Transverse Process Fracture
fracture.description: A fracture of the small, bony projections on the vertebrae, typically caused by trauma or severe muscle contractions.

dislocation.name: Vertebral Dislocation
dislocation.description: Displacement of a vertebra, often caused by high-energy trauma or underlying instability.

tendinitis.name: Lumbar Tendinitis
tendinitis.description: Inflammation of tendons in the lower back, typically caused by overuse or repetitive movements.

impingement.name: Spinal Stenosis
impingement.description: Narrowing of the spinal canal, causing compression of the spinal cord or nerves and resulting in pain and weakness.

impingement.name: Facet Joint Impingement
impingement.description: Compression or irritation of the small joints that connect vertebrae, often leading to localized back pain.

curvatures.name: Scoliosis
curvatures.description: A lateral curvature of the spine, often diagnosed in adolescence or caused by degenerative changes in adults.

curvatures.name: Kyphosis
curvatures.description: Excessive outward curvature of the thoracic spine, causing a hunched appearance.

curvatures.name: Lordosis
curvatures.description: Excessive inward curvature of the lumbar spine, often leading to lower back pain.

sprain.name: Elbow Ligament Sprain
sprain.description: Overstretching or tearing of the ligaments around the elbow joint, often caused by trauma or excessive force.

sprain.name: Ulnar Collateral Ligament (UCL) Sprain
sprain.description: Injury to the ligament on the inner side of the elbow, common in throwing sports due to repetitive stress.

strain.name: Elbow Flexor Strain
strain.description: Overstretching or tearing of the muscles that flex the elbow, often caused by heavy lifting or sudden force.

strain.name: Extensor Strain
strain.description: Injury to the muscles that extend the elbow, typically resulting from overuse or repetitive activities.

tear.name: Biceps Tendon Tear
tear.description: A tear of the biceps tendon at its attachment point, commonly caused by heavy lifting or trauma.

tendinitis.name: Tennis Elbow (Lateral Epicondylitis)
tendinitis.description: Inflammation of the tendons on the outer side of the elbow, caused by repetitive wrist and arm motions.

tendinitis.name: Golfer's Elbow (Medial Epicondylitis)
tendinitis.description: Inflammation of the tendons on the inner side of the elbow, associated with repetitive wrist flexion or gripping.

tendinitis.name: Triceps Tendinitis
tendinitis.description: Inflammation of the triceps tendon at its insertion point on the elbow, commonly caused by overuse.

tendinitis.name: Biceps Tendinitis
tendinitis.description: Inflammation of the biceps tendon at the elbow, often resulting from repetitive lifting or pulling motions.

bursitis.name: Olecranon Bursitis
bursitis.description: Inflammation of the bursa over the bony prominence of the elbow, often caused by repetitive pressure or trauma.

fracture.name: Radial Head Fracture
fracture.description: A fracture of the radial head, typically caused by a fall on an outstretched arm.

fracture.name: Olecranon Fracture
fracture.description: A fracture of the bony tip of the elbow, commonly resulting from direct trauma.

fracture.name: Distal Humerus Fracture
fracture.description: A break in the lower end of the humerus, often caused by falls or high-energy trauma.

dislocation.name: Elbow Dislocation
dislocation.description: Displacement of the bones in the elbow joint, commonly caused by falls onto an outstretched hand.

dislocation.name: Nursemaid's Elbow
dislocation.description: A partial dislocation of the radial head, typically occurring in young children when the arm is pulled suddenly.

neuropathy.name: Cubital Tunnel Syndrome
neuropathy.description: Compression of the ulnar nerve at the elbow, causing pain, tingling, and weakness in the ring and little fingers.

neuropathy.name: Radial Tunnel Syndrome
neuropathy.description: Compression of the radial nerve near the elbow, leading to pain in the forearm and hand weakness.

impingement.name: Posterior Impingement Syndrome
impingement.description: Pinching of soft tissues at the back of the elbow joint during extension, often seen in throwing athletes.

overuse.name: Little League Elbow
overuse.description: An overuse injury causing inflammation of the growth plate on the inside of the elbow, common in young baseball players.

overuse.name: Repetitive Strain Injury
overuse.description: Cumulative stress on the muscles and tendons of the elbow due to repetitive motion.

sprain.name: Wrist Sprain
sprain.description: Overstretching or tearing of ligaments in the wrist, often caused by falls or sudden twisting motions.

sprain.name: Thumb Sprain
sprain.description: Injury to the ligaments in the thumb, commonly involving the ulnar collateral ligament (Skier's Thumb).

strain.name: Flexor Tendon Strain
strain.description: Overstretching or tearing of the tendons that flex the fingers or wrist, often caused by overuse or excessive force.

strain.name: Extensor Tendon Strain
strain.description: Injury to the tendons that extend the fingers or wrist, typically resulting from repetitive strain.

fracture.name: Distal Radius Fracture
fracture.description: A fracture of the radius near the wrist, often caused by a fall on an outstretched hand.

fracture.name: Scaphoid Fracture
fracture.description: A break in the scaphoid bone of the wrist, commonly resulting from a fall on an outstretched hand.

fracture.name: Metacarpal Fracture
fracture.description: A fracture in one of the hand bones, often caused by trauma or a direct blow.

fracture.name: Phalangeal Fracture
fracture.description: A fracture of the finger bones, typically caused by impact or crushing injuries.

dislocation.name: Finger Dislocation
dislocation.description: Displacement of the finger bones at a joint, usually caused by trauma or hyperextension.

dislocation.name: Wrist Dislocation
dislocation.description: Displacement of the carpal bones, often due to high-energy trauma or falls.

tendinitis.name: De Quervain's Tendinitis
tendinitis.description: Inflammation of the tendons on the thumb side of the wrist, often caused by repetitive gripping or lifting.

tendinitis.name: Flexor Tendinitis
tendinitis.description: Inflammation of the tendons that flex the fingers or wrist, typically caused by overuse.

tendinitis.name: Extensor Tendinitis
tendinitis.description: Inflammation of the tendons that extend the fingers or wrist, commonly due to repetitive strain.

neuropathy.name: Carpal Tunnel Syndrome
neuropathy.description: Compression of the median nerve in the wrist, leading to pain, numbness, and weakness in the hand.

neuropathy.name: Ulnar Nerve Entrapment
neuropathy.description: Compression of the ulnar nerve at the wrist or hand, causing tingling and weakness in the ring and little fingers.

bursitis.name: Wrist Bursitis
bursitis.description: Inflammation of the bursa in the wrist, often caused by repetitive motion or pressure.

impingement.name: Wrist Impingement Syndrome
impingement.description: Pinching of soft tissues in the wrist, often leading to pain during extension or weight-bearing activities.

overuse.name: Trigger Finger
overuse.description: A condition where a finger gets stuck in a bent position due to inflammation of the flexor tendons.

overuse.name: Repetitive Strain Injury (RSI)
overuse.description: Cumulative trauma to the hand or wrist due to repetitive motions or overuse.

overuse.name: Tendinopathy
overuse.description: Degeneration of the wrist or hand tendons, often caused by chronic overuse.

arthritis.name: Osteoarthritis of the Hand
arthritis.description: Degenerative joint disease causing pain, stiffness, and swelling in the hand and wrist.

arthritis.name: Rheumatoid Arthritis of the Wrist
arthritis.description: An autoimmune condition causing inflammation, pain, and joint deformities in the wrist.

sprain.name: Hip Joint Sprain
sprain.description: Overstretching or tearing of the ligaments surrounding the hip joint, often caused by sudden twisting or trauma.

strain.name: Hamstring Strain
strain.description: Overstretching or tearing of the hamstring muscles, commonly caused by rapid acceleration or deceleration.

strain.name: Quadriceps Strain
strain.description: Injury to the quadriceps muscles, often due to overuse or sudden forceful extension of the knee.

strain.name: Hip Flexor Strain
strain.description: Injury to the muscles responsible for hip flexion, typically caused by overuse or sudden, explosive movements.

strain.name: Adductor Strain (Groin Pull)
strain.description: Injury to the adductor muscles on the inner thigh, commonly resulting from rapid side-to-side movements.

fracture.name: Femoral Neck Fracture
fracture.description: A break in the neck of the femur, often caused by falls or high-energy trauma, common in older adults.

fracture.name: Intertrochanteric Fracture
fracture.description: A fracture between the greater and lesser trochanters of the femur, typically resulting from a fall.

fracture.name: Pelvic Fracture
fracture.description: A break in one or more bones of the pelvis, often caused by high-energy trauma or falls.

dislocation.name: Hip Dislocation
dislocation.description: Displacement of the femoral head from the hip socket, commonly caused by high-energy trauma such as car accidents.

tendinitis.name: Iliopsoas Tendinitis
tendinitis.description: Inflammation of the iliopsoas tendon, often caused by repetitive hip flexion or overuse.

tendinitis.name: Gluteal Tendinitis
tendinitis.description: Inflammation of the tendons of the gluteal muscles, often due to overuse or repetitive activities.

tendinitis.name: Hamstring Tendinitis
tendinitis.description: Inflammation of the hamstring tendons, commonly caused by overuse or repetitive activities involving the thigh.

bursitis.name: Trochanteric Bursitis
bursitis.description: Inflammation of the bursa over the greater trochanter of the femur, leading to lateral hip pain.

bursitis.name: Iliopsoas Bursitis
bursitis.description: Inflammation of the bursa near the iliopsoas muscle, often causing groin or anterior hip pain.

bursitis.name: Ischial Bursitis
bursitis.description: Inflammation of the bursa near the ischial tuberosity, often caused by prolonged sitting or repetitive activities.

neuropathy.name: Piriformis Syndrome
neuropathy.description: Compression of the sciatic nerve by the piriformis muscle, causing pain and numbness in the hip and thigh.

neuropathy.name: Meralgia Paresthetica
neuropathy.description: Compression of the lateral femoral cutaneous nerve, leading to burning or tingling in the outer thigh.

impingement.name: Femoroacetabular Impingement (FAI)
impingement.description: Abnormal contact between the femur and hip socket, causing pain and restricted range of motion.

overuse.name: Stress Fracture of the Femur
overuse.description: A small crack in the femur due to repetitive stress or overuse, common in runners and athletes.

arthritis.name: Hip Osteoarthritis
arthritis.description: Degenerative joint disease causing pain, stiffness, and reduced mobility in the hip joint.

arthritis.name: Rheumatoid Arthritis of the Hip
arthritis.description: An autoimmune condition causing inflammation, pain, and joint deformities in the hip.

sprain.name: Medial Collateral Ligament (MCL) Sprain
sprain.description: Overstretching or tearing of the ligament on the inner side of the knee, often caused by impact or twisting.

sprain.name: Lateral Collateral Ligament (LCL) Sprain
sprain.description: Injury to the ligament on the outer side of the knee, commonly caused by direct force to the inside of the knee.

sprain.name: Anterior Cruciate Ligament (ACL) Sprain
sprain.description: A partial or complete tear of the ACL, often caused by sudden stops, pivots, or changes in direction.

sprain.name: Posterior Cruciate Ligament (PCL) Sprain
sprain.description: Injury to the ligament at the back of the knee, typically caused by a direct impact to the front of the knee.

strain.name: Calf Muscle Strain
strain.description: Overstretching or tearing of the muscles in the back of the lower leg, commonly caused by sudden movements.

strain.name: Quadriceps Strain
strain.description: Injury to the thigh muscles responsible for knee extension, often caused by overuse or forceful movements.

fracture.name: Patella Fracture
fracture.description: A break in the kneecap, often caused by direct trauma or a fall onto the knee.

fracture.name: Tibial Plateau Fracture
fracture.description: A fracture in the upper part of the tibia near the knee joint, commonly caused by high-energy trauma.

fracture.name: Fibula Fracture
fracture.description: A break in the fibula bone of the lower leg, often resulting from trauma or impact.

fracture.name: Tibial Stress Fracture
fracture.description: A small crack in the tibia bone due to repetitive stress or overuse, common in runners.

dislocation.name: Knee Dislocation
dislocation.description: Displacement of the knee joint, often caused by high-energy trauma or severe ligament injuries.

dislocation.name: Patellar Dislocation
dislocation.description: Displacement of the kneecap from its normal position, typically caused by sudden twisting or impact.

tendinitis.name: Patellar Tendinitis (Jumper's Knee)
tendinitis.description: Inflammation of the patellar tendon, commonly caused by repetitive jumping or stress on the knee.

tendinitis.name: Quadriceps Tendinitis
tendinitis.description: Inflammation of the quadriceps tendon above the kneecap, often due to overuse or repetitive strain.

bursitis.name: Prepatellar Bursitis (Housemaid's Knee)
bursitis.description: Inflammation of the bursa in front of the kneecap, often caused by prolonged kneeling or direct impact.

bursitis.name: Infrapatellar Bursitis
bursitis.description: Inflammation of the bursa below the kneecap, typically resulting from repetitive movements or overuse.

bursitis.name: Pes Anserine Bursitis
bursitis.description: Inflammation of the bursa on the inner side of the knee, often caused by overuse or improper technique.

chondropathy.name: Meniscus Tear
chondropathy.description: A tear in the cartilage that cushions the knee joint, often caused by twisting or heavy impact.

chondropathy.name: Chondromalacia Patellae
chondropathy.description: Softening or breakdown of cartilage on the underside of the kneecap, leading to pain and discomfort.

neuropathy.name: Peroneal Nerve Compression
neuropathy.description: Compression of the peroneal nerve near the knee, leading to numbness, tingling, or weakness in the lower leg.

impingement.name: Fat Pad Impingement
impingement.description: Irritation of the fat pad beneath the patella, causing anterior knee pain and swelling.

overuse.name: Iliotibial Band Syndrome (ITBS)
overuse.description: Irritation of the iliotibial band as it rubs against the femur, often causing lateral thigh or knee pain.

overuse.name: Patellofemoral Pain Syndrome (Runner's Knee)
overuse.description: Pain around or behind the kneecap, often associated with overuse, poor alignment, or improper mechanics.

overuse.name: Shin Splints (Medial Tibial Stress Syndrome)
overuse.description: Pain along the shinbone, often caused by repetitive stress or improper training techniques.

arthritis.name: Knee Osteoarthritis
arthritis.description: Degenerative joint disease causing pain, stiffness, and swelling in the knee joint.

arthritis.name: Rheumatoid Arthritis of the Knee
arthritis.description: An autoimmune condition causing inflammation, pain, and joint deformities in the knee.

sprain.name: Ankle Sprain
sprain.description: Overstretching or tearing of the ligaments in the ankle, often caused by twisting or rolling the foot.

sprain.name: High Ankle Sprain
sprain.description: Injury to the ligaments connecting the tibia and fibula above the ankle joint, commonly caused by twisting motions.

strain.name: Achilles Strain
strain.description: Overstretching or tearing of the Achilles tendon or surrounding muscle fibers, often caused by overuse or sudden force.

strain.name: Plantar Fascia Strain
strain.description: Injury to the plantar fascia, the connective tissue along the bottom of the foot, often due to overuse or improper footwear.

fracture.name: Ankle Fracture
fracture.description: A break in one or more bones of the ankle, often caused by trauma or severe twisting.

fracture.name: Metatarsal Fracture
fracture.description: A break in one of the metatarsal bones of the foot, commonly resulting from impact or overuse.

fracture.name: Calcaneal Fracture
fracture.description: A break in the heel bone, often caused by a fall from a height or significant impact.

fracture.name: Stress Fracture
fracture.description: A small crack in a bone due to repetitive stress or overuse, common in the metatarsals or tibia.

dislocation.name: Ankle Dislocation
dislocation.description: Displacement of the bones in the ankle joint, often caused by trauma or severe ligament injury.

dislocation.name: Subtalar Dislocation
dislocation.description: Displacement of the talus relative to the calcaneus and navicular bones, typically caused by high-energy trauma.

tendinitis.name: Achilles Tendinitis
tendinitis.description: Inflammation of the Achilles tendon, often caused by repetitive strain or overuse.

tendinitis.name: Posterior Tibial Tendinitis
tendinitis.description: Inflammation of the posterior tibial tendon, commonly leading to pain along the inner side of the ankle and foot.

tendinitis.name: Peroneal Tendinitis
tendinitis.description: Inflammation of the peroneal tendons on the outer side of the ankle, often caused by repetitive activity.

tendinitis.name: Extensor Tendinitis
tendinitis.description: Inflammation of the tendons on the top of the foot, often resulting from tight shoes or overuse.

bursitis.name: Retrocalcaneal Bursitis
bursitis.description: Inflammation of the bursa behind the Achilles tendon, causing pain and swelling near the heel.

bursitis.name: Plantar Bursitis
bursitis.description: Inflammation of the bursa in the sole of the foot, often associated with overuse or improper footwear.

neuropathy.name: Tarsal Tunnel Syndrome
neuropathy.description: Compression of the posterior tibial nerve in the tarsal tunnel, causing pain, tingling, or numbness in the foot.

neuropathy.name: Morton's Neuroma
neuropathy.description: Thickening of tissue around a nerve in the foot, often causing pain between the toes.

overuse.name: Plantar Fasciitis
overuse.description: Inflammation of the plantar fascia, causing heel pain, often due to overuse, improper footwear, or tight calf muscles.

arthritis.name: Ankle Osteoarthritis
arthritis.description: Degenerative joint disease causing pain, stiffness, and reduced mobility in the ankle.

arthritis.name: Rheumatoid Arthritis of the Foot
arthritis.description: An autoimmune condition causing inflammation, pain, and deformities in the joints of the foot and ankle.

impingement.name: Anterior Ankle Impingement
impingement.description: Pinching of soft tissues at the front of the ankle, often causing pain during dorsiflexion.

impingement.name: Posterior Ankle Impingement
impingement.description: Compression of tissues at the back of the ankle, commonly seen in activities like ballet or soccer.
